question: which greek god flew too close to the sun
vanilla_rag_result: The Greek figure who is famously known for flying too close to the sun is Icarus. He is the son of Daedalus, who crafted wings made of feathers and wax for them to escape from Crete. Despite his father's warnings, Icarus flew too high, causing the sun to melt the wax in his wings, leading to his fall into the sea.
